revised_title: Investigating the Collision of Bodies and the True Doctrine of Moving Bodies
tldr: The author, John Smeaton, conducts experiments to investigate the collision of bodies and the true doctrine of moving bodies. He examines the laws of collision for three types of bodies: perfectly elastic, perfectly unelastic and soft, and perfectly unelastic and hard. Smeaton challenges the assumption that the velocity after collision is the same for non-elastic hard and soft bodies, and provides evidence through experiments on mills to support his findings.
